channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: German FA slaps down proposal to boycott World Cup as Trump rebuke: ‘debates on sports policy should be conducted internally and not in public’
item.description: Oke Göttlich, who is also the president of Bundesliga club St. Pauli, referred to Trump's recent actions and and said it was time to consider a boycot...

item.title: NYT Strands Hints, Spangram, Answers: Wednesday, February 4 (For The Enthusiast)
item.description: Looking for some help with today's NYT Strands? An extra hint and the answers are right here to help you finish the grid and keep your streak intact.

item.title: One of the most generous welfare states in the world is no match for the ‘motherhood penalty’
item.description: Subsidized child care is available for all children from 6 months old in Denmark, and parents pay no more than 25.%. Pay for women still goes down.

item.title: Arcam Launches New Radia Range Of AV Amps, Processors And Power Amplifiers
item.description: Beautiful design meets power and precision in this new six-product series.

item.title: Why India’s $2.2B Carbon Capture Bet Is About Trade, Not Just Climate
item.description: India’s $2.4B carbon capture investment reveals how trade pressure, EU CBAM, and global shifts are driving climate action as the U.S. falls behind.

item.title: Fed's Miran maintains call for aggressive interest rate cuts this year
item.description: Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran is calling for aggressive interest rate cuts exceeding one percentage point after dissenting in the latest FOMC...

item.title: Oracle billionaire Larry Ellison’s next big bet: Redefining how long–and how well–we live
item.description: As people live longer and birth rates fall, longevity is becoming a major challenge–and opportunity–for business and society alike.

item.title: Quordle Hints And Answers For Wednesday, February 4
item.description: Looking for some help with today’s Quordle words? Some hints and the answers are right here to give you a hand.

item.title: One Of The Best Sci-Fi Movies Ever Is Back On Netflix, Which Now Seems Ahead Of Its Time
item.description: Netflix has gotten one of the best sci-fi movies of all time back on the service, and now it feels prescient, watching it eleven years later.

item.title: Famed startup incubator Y Combinator to let founders receive funds in stablecoins
item.description: The move is significant since, in the past, generally just crypto VC firms have let startups receive funding in the form of digital assets.

item.title: Kairos, which is building a cross-platform tool for prediction markets traders, raises $2.5 million from a16z crypto
item.description: The startup’s platform will display bets from Kalshi and Polymarket.

item.title: What investors should know about Disney’s next CEO, Josh D’Amaro
S&P starts session near all-time high as gold and silver rebound — follow live
Now that SpaceX and xAI have merged, is a Tesla deal next?
PayPal’s stock is on track for its second-worst day ever
House vote today could end the partial government shutdown
Government shutdown will delay release of January jobs report
item.description: The partial government shutdown that began over the weekend will delay the release of the January jobs report slated for release on Friday.

item.title: Here's when taxpayers will get their refunds
item.description: The IRS typically processes tax refunds within 21 days for e-filed returns, while mailed returns take six weeks or more to process during the 2025 tax...

item.title: New SNAP work requirements take effect in more states under Trump-backed law
item.description: New SNAP work requirements are taking effect in additional states, expanding eligibility rules and reshaping benefits under a Trump-backed law.

item.title: Costco issues recall notice for bakery item due to undeclared allergen
item.description: Costco has recalled mislabeled "Mini Beignets filled with Caramel" that could cause allergic reactions due to undeclared tree nuts in 22 states.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
